message: I'm looking for a sub-$300 120GB~ SSD. The main one's I've been looking at are the Crucial M4, Intel 510, and OCZ Vertex 3. I'm leaning towards the Crucial because it's the cheapest and has good newegg reviews. I heard Intel made really good SSDs and OCZs are fastest but least reliable.
Any thoughts? I'm not limiting myself to the SSDs listed.
I've heard good things about the Intel crowd.

OWC SSD are fast, conservatively engineered, and have excellent customer support. http://eshop.macsales.com/item/OWC/SSDMX115/ - I'm a satisfied customer, no other connection with them. Also check out AnandTech for multivendor SSD comparisons http://www.anandtech.com/tag/storage
Check out the Kingston ssdnow. I use it in my build. Wait for a good rebate on Newegg and you may be able to get it for less than $200 like I did.
I actually went with the OCZ Vertex 3 120GB (MAX IOPS). There's a $40 off + free shipping sale on newegg.ca, so I jumped on that deal.
